direction.raw_text: . The station manager. Stiff. Ex-army officer. Wears a handgun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Six-four. Two-fifty. Black. A mechanic. Can be jolly. But don't mess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Sensitive. Intelligent. Unassuming. An assistant biologist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COPPER 45. Professional. A decent man. A good doctor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Second string chopper pilot. Crack mechanic. Long hair. Slight sixties acid damage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The cook. Bright. Black. Irreverent. But kindhearted. Roller skates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Stocky. Rugged looking. A geophysicist. An incipient heart condition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A meteorologist. Dutiful. An old pro.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The dog handler. Likes it here. Good at his job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The radio operator. Hates it here. Lousy at his job. In the winter of 1982 these men were commissioned by the United States National Science Foundation to gather data concerning the physical and natural sciences on the continent of Antarctica.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The interior is a cramped and never ending maze of hallways, passageways and doors which connect the many rooms and compartments within the compound. Sturdy, but prefabricated materials have been used in its construction. There is a laboratory. An infirmary. A kitchen and mess hall. A communications room and sleeping quarters. Other cubicles are for storage and supplies. The most spacious area of the building, and the main center of activity, is the Rec Room. Of the many entrance ways to this room can be seen the small work chambers with their sophisticated computers and other scientific equipment. The below quarter houses the generator and still other compartments for storage. A long underground tunnel connects the main compound to the dog kennel.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: .S. OUTPOST #31
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: From out of the billions, the smallest of specks drives slowly forward. It closes; getting larger; its features becoming more identifiable: a vessel. Flip-flopping; out of control. Its stern roaring with flame. It passes; its blue fire surging into the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A thundering...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Glacial desert... gusts of snow... superimpose:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Loud and strident. A helicopter streaks across frame. It travels precariously close to the ground; its chassis battered and swayed by the wind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Red dials beam on the faces of two men. One carries a rifle and searches the horizon with binoculars. The other pilots. Their unkempt faces, their blazing eyes notate a wildness. They bark at each other in some Scandinavian tongue. Two men arguing like mad and desperate children. The man with the binoculars sights something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It turns and snarls at the craft some fifteen hundred yards to its rear. Then whirls and gallops off. A gun blast kicks up snow at its heels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another blast of rifle fire as the man takes issue with his prey. The pilot slams a fist into his gunman friend and implores for better aim. The craft swoops lower and the engine is put into full throttle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: running feverishly up and over a hill of ice. A weather- beaten, wooden sign sticks up on the other side: U.S. NATIONAL SCIENCE FOUNDATION -- OUTPOST #31 A rifle blast kicks up more snow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .S. OUTPOST #31 A large, almost snow-covered building. Not far from that a tall, meteorological balloon tower. A scattering of several small shacks at varying distances from the main compound. The smaller hovels are connected by wooden planked walkways and steadying ropes. Multicolored pennants stick put of the snow marking pathways and directions to outdoor experiments. A tractor and two helicopters sit idle, covered with mounds of continuously mounting snow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: standing some thirty yards from the main building are in the process of letting up a large red balloon. Childs, a hefty black man, is twenty yards away tinkering with a snowmobile. Their beards are caked with ice. It is winter and it is harsh. The faint sound of the copter turns their attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: flying ever lower now. The man with the gun leans dangerously outside and fires away at the dog as it nears the outpost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: outside the compound look to one another, incredulous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: much too low now, and chastised by the wind, attempts a high- speed landing, directly on the heels of the sprinting dog. It bounces violently on the hard-packed surface. Once. Twice. Passing the dog. A third bounce sends it skidding. It flips; its blades snapping off like toothpicks. It lands belly-up, soundless except for the whine of its engine. The man with the gun rolls out before the explosion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The half a dozen men, playing cards, monitoring equipment, listening to music -- spring to their feet, startled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dog reaches Norris and Bennings, as they awkwardly wade through the snow, toward the downed copter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of the crash, his eyes crazed with determination, struggles to his feet. Heedless of his companion, he double-times his way to the men and the dog. He reloads his gun and bellows in his Scandinavian tongue. Norris and Bennings have no idea what he is saying. The survivor waves his arms as if shooting them off, screaming as he does so; his face now caked with blood. The two men are bewildered. The dog jumps up, licking and pawing them, imploring for safety. Blam!! The visitor fires. The men jump back in disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blam! Blam! The crazed visitor screams and fires as he stalks after them. His countenance ablaze, mad. Ice and snow kick up about the terrified Americans. A bullet smacks into the dog's hip, sending it skidding and howling in pain. Childs, the black man by the snowmobile, takes cover, diving behind his machine. Bennings is hit. Norris pulls, drags him back toward the compound. The dog crawls along beside them. The intruder is relentless in his assail. He runs, screaming, firing, screaming, reloading and firing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What the fu...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Total confusion. Some watch helplessly through the small, fogged-up and translucent windows. Others try to mobilize grabbing for their heavy jackets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON A .357 MAGNUM as it efficiently breaks through a windowpane and into the cold. A steady hand grips it firmly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: getting closer. Kablam! Suddenly, his head jerks back. He falls to his knees and then face down into the snow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stare blankly, but relievedly at the fallen man. The dog whimpers in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pokes his head out from under the snowmobile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The rumbling of voices fades. The men adjust their eyes to station manager Garry, as he extracts his gun from the broken window, relieves it of its spent shell and puts it away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Several men spray snow on the burning wreckage. There is no hope for the pilot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COMPOUND CLOSE ON THE PALLID FACE OF THE SCANDINAVIAN INTRUDER A neat round hole is set in the middle of his forehead. Station manager Garry holds up something akin to an ID.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuchs, a young and sensitive-looking biologist, stands closest to the large area map of Antarctica. Several men sit and stand around viewing the body that lies on two brought- together card-tables.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Garry directs his attention to Childs, the large black man who had been working on the snowmobile. Next to him sits Norris, the rugged-looking, fortyish, geophysicist, who was one of the men being shot at.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Garry motions inquiringly to Norris.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Norwegian... Jans Bolen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gotta be from the Norwegian camp.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How far's that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: 'Bout eighty kilos southwest.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (surprised) That far?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You catch anything he was saying?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Am I starting to look Norwegian to you, Bwana?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. I caught that he wanted the better part of my ass to come apart.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Dr. Cooper, mid-forties, works on the outstretched leg of Bennings, the meteorologist. Clark, the dog handler, is mending the hip of the wounded dog off in the corner. Bennings lets out with an ouch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He helps a shaken Bennings up off the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dog yelps and whimpers as Clark tries to calm him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER Don't "ouch" me. Two stitches. It just grazed you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What in the hell were they doing...? Flying that low... shooting at a dog... at us...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER Stir crazy. Cabin fever... Who knows.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll be here a while. Shell's pretty deep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Blair, senior biologist, fifty, balding, leans against the entrance door. He looks on as the young, bored-looking radio operator, Sanchez, attends to his equipment. Bursts of static.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's no go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, get to somebody. Anybody. We've got to report this mess.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, I haven't been able to reach shit in two weeks. Doubt if anybody's talked to anybody on the whole continent.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Nauls, the cook, glides along on his roller stakes down one of the many narrow hallways that connect the various compartments of the main compound. He is black, a little mischievous, about twenty-two. He comes to a flashy skidding stop at one of the entrances to the rec room area, where the men are gathered with the dead Norwegian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Palmer, a spacy, twenty-seven year old, novice pilot and mechanic, grins as he lights a joint. He directs a remark to station manager Garry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Garry rebukes him with a stern look and then turns to Fuchs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuchs leafing through a pile of papers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Copper enters the room. Bennings limping after him slightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Palmer smiles and flips the cook the bird.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men's attention turn to Copper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Garry still does not much like the idea. Palmer takes another hit off his joint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slight laughter from some of the men.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe we at war with Norway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Was wondering when "El Capitan" was going to get a chance to use his pop gun.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How long have they been stationed there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Says here about eight weeks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shaking his head) That's not enough time for guys to go bonkers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bullshit, Bwana, sweetheart. Five minutes is enough to put a man over down here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Damn straight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I mean Palmer been the way he is since the first day.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How many in their party?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (referring) Started with six. There'd be four others left.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER How do you know?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER ...Guys as crazy as that could have done a lot of damage to their own before they got to us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing we can do about that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER Yes, there is. I'd like to go up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In this weather?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER (turns to) Bennings?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Winds are going to let up a tad, next couple of hours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A tad?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can't condone it myself. But it is a short haul. Hour there, hour back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shit, Doc, I'll give you the lift if...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forget it, Palmer. Doc, you're a pain in the ass.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (turns) Norris, go get MacReady.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grins) MacReady ain't going nowhere. Bunkered in till spring.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just go get him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stands) Anyway, he's probably ripped.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .S. OUTPOST #31 Norris, bundled in his sixty-five pounds of clothing, exits the main compound. He walks the prefab wooden planks up the precipice; his destination is someone a hundred yards up the slope -- to a shack. He grabs onto the steadying ropes and pulls himself against the wind and blowing sleet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: being dumped into a glass, followed by the pouring of whiskey. An electronic Voice is heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady takes a sip of his drink; makes his way over to his electronic chess game. A large Mexican sombrero hangs on his back. He is tall; about thirty-five. His shack is sparse but unkempt. A few centerfolds on the wall are interspersed by an occasional poster of some Mediterranean or South American paradise. The chess game is of larger than normal size. The pieces move automatically with the press of a button. He sits down and chuckles over his opponent's bad move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He confidently taps out his move. His companion's response is immediate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady's grin slowly fades as he examines the board. There is a pounding at his door. MacReady broods for a bit, heedless of his visitor and makes his next move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More impatient pounding. MacReady glares at his opponent for a beat. He bends forward, opens up a flap containing the chess game's circuitry and pours in his drink. There ensues a snapping, popping sound as smoke and sparks rise from the machine; followed by a flush of chess gibberish. MacReady gets up from his seat, mumbling on his way to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He opens the door. Norris steps in followed by a flurry of snow and wind.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Bishop to knight four.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Poor little son of a bitch. You're starting to lose it, aren't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pawn takes queen at knight four.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Rook to knight six. Check.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Cheating bastard...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You jerking off or just pissed?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We got any more of those electronic chess things down in supply?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get your gear on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: One of the grounded choppers is being readied for take-off. Childs holds a huge industrial torch to the engine, warming it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Garry, Bennings, Dr. Copper, Palmer and MacReady wind their way through the slender corridors on their way to the chopper. Dr. Copper carries a satchel of medicine supplies. MacReady, going over his flight chart, looks mad as hell. Dialogue overlaps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Craziness... This is goddamn insane...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Quit the griping MacReady. Sooner you're there -- sooner you're back.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's against regulations to go up this time of year!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER Screw regulations! Four guys could be crawling around on their bellies out there!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So, I don't want to end up crawling around with them when we go down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, if you're going to keep bitching, MacReady -- Palmer's offered to take him up...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you talking?! He's had two months training in those choppers!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (defiant) Four!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Bennings) What is it out there, anyway? Forty- five knots?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sixteen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (disgusted) And the horse you rode in on. Sixteen for how long?! You can't predict this time of year...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CHOPPER Dr. Copper sits next to MacReady, who is at the controls. MacReady tightens the string of his sombrero around his neck and starts up its choking engine. MacReady fights violently with the controls as he struggles to get the craft into the air. It finally rights itself and moves up and off into the grey-white sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A couple of the men mingle in the area. Clark, the dog handler, looks out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dog, a large bandage on his hip, wades through the room. Under tables. Past men's legs. It hobbles slightly. No one takes notice.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mac's really taking it up, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: moves over a ridge of ice. Columns of smoke can be seen rising ominously from a quarter mile off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they near, the smoke looms thicker. A black, tar-like gush; billowing up into the grey sky from the whiteness below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smoke climbs upward in the f.g. MacReady sets his craft down. Pull back to reveal the camp itself: resembling the aftermath of a western fort, sacked and ravaged by Indians. Small fires and debris are strewn everywhere. The prefab Administration Building exposes gaping holes. Smoke rises from the almost entirely snow-buried Quonset huts. Embers swirl in every direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two men look at each other in silence. They get out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smoldering to a close. A hastily conceived crematorium. Wood, books, furniture, tires, anything that will burn has been mixed together with the charred remains of several dogs and the body of a man. Curious mounds of a melted and blackened goo are heaped within the mess. A small can of gasoline lies nearby. A large oil drum not far off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: their faces ashen as they take in this grotesque sight. MacReady turns to view the Norwegian compound. He then exchanges a look with Copper. MacReady heads back toward the chopper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady unhinges the shotgun that is latched to the panel behind the seats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady and Dr. Copper stand hesitantly amidst the wisps of snow and embers. MacReady tries the door. It is unlocked. He slowly pushes it open with his gun. A creaking. A long pitch- black corridor. Copper shines a flashlight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No answer. Just wind. They exchange a look and enter.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER Anybody there?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The two men move slowly. It is dank and cold. Their breath, bleating like exhaust. A soft, steady wind howls overhead. The flashlight is not much help. Further down, they hear a faint hissing sound. As they get closer it more resembles static. The flashlight finds a door at the end of the corridor. The sputtering static comes from within. The face of the door has been shredded. An ax sticks out from its middle. MacReady wrenches out the ax. There is blood on it. The men acknowledge this for a beat. MacReady tries the knob. It opens slightly. Something is blocking it from the other side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady pushes against the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They push, shove, grunt. The door gives a bit. Finally more. It widens enough for MacReady to see that a large computer- like machine is blocking their path. MacReady wedges in and shines the flashlight. It is the communications room. Holes in its roof have allowed in the freezing cold. The flashlight exposes the back of the radio chair. One more nudge allows them into the room. A beat as they catch their breath. MacReady spots a Coleman lantern. He lights it with a match. Holds it up. The brighter light exposes the top of a man's head sitting in the radio chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The chair rocks slightly with the gentle breeze. They inch closer. A yard from the chair, MacReady stops the Doctor. He pokes his gun at the chair's back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Copper spots something. From the man's wrist on the armrest, he follows a long, yarn-thick, red line, ending in a pool of frozen blood on the floor. The two men step around the chair. The Norwegian stares up in blanched death. A gaping black hole for a mouth. His throat and wrists slit. An old-fashioned straight razor in his lap. MacReady turns off the hissing radio, and marches to the other door. It is locked and barricaded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two men free a machine-like obstacle from the other exit. MacReady opens a lock and pushes the door open. More blackness. Stronger wind. Copper holds the lantern high as they make their way down a row of wooden steps and into a cavernous, underground causeway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whap!! Something slaps into the Doctor's face from the darkness. The lantern crashes to the ground. The Doctor stumbles, falls. MacReady grabs the flashlight and whirls in different directions. A panting beat. Silence. Dr. Copper holds up what hit him. A thick centerfold, buffeted by the wind. MacReady takes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady pockets it for further viewing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Anybody in there?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER We're Americans!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come to help you!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Give me a hand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Sweden...! You okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sweden?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER (more to himself) My God, what in hell happened here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, Copper.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Sweden!!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER (irritated) They're not Swedish, goddamn it, they're Norwegian, MacRe --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Norwegian of the Month, Doc. Harmless.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The supporting beams have long since buckled and cracked from the constantly moving ice underneath. The evidence of fire has further weakened the foundations. The wood creaks overhead. Bits of ice and silt trickle down. The two men walk hunched, cautious. MacReady gingerly tries to make his way around a broken and smoldering beam. He brushes it gently sending a shower of debris from the yawning roof. The two men wait until it subsides and then moves on. Further down. MacReady's knee bumps into something along the wall, causing him to stumble slightly. He shines his light on it. An arm is sticking out of a steel door about three feet off the ground. The door has been slammed shut. The arm pinned, its fist still gripping a small welding torch. The flame long since gone out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tries the door. Unlocked. It opens. The arm drops to the ground. It has been severed by the force of the slam. Its owner is nowhere to be seen. MacReady, sickened, coughs. Dr. Copper mumbles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They step over the arm and into another slim passageway. Moving along they come to rest in front of a door with Norwegian lettering on it. MacReady pushes it open with his foot. Dozens of papers fly about, flailed by the holes in the Quonset hut-style roof. The place is a wreck. They enter. MacReady surveying the small room with his flashlight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Broken beakers, test tubes, a microscope are illuminated. MacReady notices a video camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Copper makes his way over to the main work table. He shuffles through papers, glancing at the writing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Copper bends down and begins gathering the papers, strewn about the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He exits. Amongst the rubble, Dr. Copper finds a pocket tape recorder and several cassettes. He selects a tape and is about to pop it in when he senses something to his rear. He turns. Looks. A beat. Nothing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (wincing) Holy shit...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER Christ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER ...Laboratory.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Portable video unit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anything?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER All in Norwegian.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER Could be important work. Might as well bring it back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's getting late. Hurry it. I'm going to check the last few rooms.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: MacReady shoves himself into another room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Debris and wood flush down on him. The receding ceiling had been blocking the door from above. He brushes his coat and shines the light upwards. The ceiling is a shambles. He then shines the light deeper into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Copper is playing the small tape recorder. A casual Norwegian voice drones on as if making notes. He fast forwards. The same casual drone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Copper, come here!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Dr. Copper enters, squeezing in, through the door. The wood cracks overhead. More debris comes falling down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Copper dusts himself. MacReady stands before a huge block of ice. Fifteen feet long. Six feet wide. Four feet tall. It has partially melted, but its thawing process has been stopped by the now freezing temperatures within the outpost. Its one curious feature: the middle has been thawed and scooped out. Giving it the appearance of a large bathtub. The two men study it uncomprehendingly. MacReady's gaze turns to a large metal cabinet at his left. He moves for a closer look. Several photographs are pasted to its door. Small snapshots of the Norwegians at work and play. He tries to open it. Stuck. The partially caved-in ceiling is slightly blocking the top of the door. He tries again, careful not to dislodge the wood and plaster above. Bits of dust float down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His grip is too strong. It gives suddenly, unexpectedly. The large metal door flies open. Large chunks splash from the ceiling. They come thumping to the floor, behind and in front of the open cabinet door. MacReady coughs and waves away the dust. He peers inside. Nothing much. Some empty shelves. Some small scientific gear. His flashlight then locates a large photograph taped to the inside of the cabinet door. It is a picture of five Norwegians, arm in arm, all smiles, toasting each other. They are on either side of the frozen block of ice, pridefully displaying it for the camera. The block looks much thicker. Its interior opaque. MacReady looks to the block of ice and then back to the photograph. He untapes it, pockets it and shuts the door. An armless corpse swings into his face from behind the closing door. Dislodged from the ceiling, the body and MacReady go crashing to the floor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Careful. It's about to go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER Watch it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .S. OUTPOST - RECREATION ROOM The loud beat of Warren Zevon's song, "The Werewolves of London," can be heard throughout the compound. The room is empty. Close on a video pong game, its ball of light lazily traveling back and forth. The dog, its tail wagging, its bandage on, walks by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zevon's record is blasting from Nauls' stereo. He skates from the big walk-in freezer and plunks down a large side of beef on the wood-cutting table to thaw. He skates from pot to pan keeping time with his sounds. He smells. Tastes. Adds a little something here, a touch there. He clearly enjoys his work. Station Manager Garry stops past the open door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He skates over and turns it down, but not much.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Turn that crap down, Nauls. You can hear it all over the camp!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oui, Bwana. Can do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Garry enters and sees that Sanchez has nodded off in front of his receiver. His headgear is still on. Garry walks over and turns up the volume, the static jolting Sanchez awake.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, man...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You reach anybody yet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're a thousand miles from anybody else, man. It's going to get a hell of a lot worse before it gets better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, stick to it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: An empty hallway. Larger than most. Doors to several sleeping quarters on either side. The dog slowly walks through. One of the doors is open up ahead of his left. The dog stops in front of it and looks in. Someone is inside. Inside the small cubicle, a slight portion of a man's back can be seen as he sits bent over a chair; his large shadow displayed on the wall. Back in the corridor. The dog looks up the hall once and casually to the other end. No one. He enters the room. The sound of a man's voice, too indistinct to tell whose, mumbles:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beat. The sound of a glass breaking. A muffled scuffling. The door is slammed shut from the inside. And then silence.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hello boy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Fuchs, the young biologist, is finishing up his daily jog around the compound. He stops at the end of a long Quonset hut almost completely buried in the snow. The hut is fifty yards long and connects to the main compound. He enters a tunnel from a latch door up top.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He jogs down the steps, passing the underground dog kennel and trots toward the compound through the long narrow tunnel. He passes and waves to Clark, who rolls along a wheelbarrow of dog food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: opens the door to the small kennel and serves up the dinner. The dogs, about seven of them, yelp and bark eagerly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: near the fuel supply bladders. Older and more rickety than the quarters above. Childs waltzes through, humming, a big smile on his face. He stops at a door with six locks on it. Different kinds. Combination locks, key locks, etc. He opens each one separately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inside are several marijuana plants. Sun lamps beam down on them. Childs inspects them with a wide grin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He moves over to a tape deck, selects a cassette, grins back at the plants and turns it on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He waters them carefully, as Al Green sings softly. He hears a panting and turns around to see the dog. His bandage is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dog is shooed off. Childs turns back grumbling.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How my brothers and sister doing today? Doin' fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What say to some nice Al Green for my babies, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What you...? You get the hell on out of here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Comin' in here... goin' to urinate on my babies.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Blair passing through, holding a chart and carrying a rack of test tubes, notices a large bandage on the floor. He picks it up, inquiringly. It is mangled and shredded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Palmer works on the generator. He hears the sound of approaching propeller blades from outside. And then the sound of his tool box crashing to the floor. He turns to see what caused the ruckus. The dog, who has entered the shed, has jumped on the work table and upended the tool box on its eagerness to look out of the above window. Palmer curses under his breath and calls out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Clark! Will you kennel this goddamn dog? (bangs wrench against pipe) Hey, Clark?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It paws at the window and watches as the chopper, carrying MacReady and Dr. Copper, fights against the newly arrived heavy winds and lands safely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Garry, MacReady, Dr. Copper, Norris, Bennings, Blair and his assistant, Fuchs, are present. The small Norwegian video unit has been set up and its contents are being viewed on a TV screen. Grainy, home movie-ish, no sound. The proceedings are grim. Shots of the Norwegian's at work. Others of them playing soccer on ice. Generally the footage is a prosaic record of their day-to-day life. Norris shuffles the bundle of notes Dr. Copper brought back with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady, working on the video machine, answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The present footage is a shot of them all naked and probably drunk, holding a sign across their waists as they stand outdoors in super-freezing weather.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady turns on the light and shuts off the video machine. He then slides the portable tape deck across the table to Dr. Copper. They exchange a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A Norwegian voice drones on calmly, making verbal notes. Norris shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Copper fast forwards. The calm voice continues. And then a loud blast, followed by pounding. The sounds of confusion. Voices. Loud. Frenetic. Men's feet running up and down wooden floorboards. A gurgling. A hissing. Screams. And then a screeching. More blasts mixed with the din of wild, carnage-wrought cries. And then more screeching. A screeching unlike anything these men have ever heard. The men look from one another in silence as they listen. Dr. Copper turns it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Copper taps the tape deck pensively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He glances at MacReady, and then back to the others.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...Seems they were spending a lot of time at a place four miles northeast of their camp.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What were they involved in?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Little ice core drilling... some seismology... glaciology... same old shit we do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How much more of this crap is there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER About nine more hours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We can't learn anything from this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER Probably right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER MacReady and I were listening to some of these cassettes on the way back. (somberly) Like you gentlemen to hear it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you want from us?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (flat) Just listen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER Goes on like that quite awhile. (beat) What do you gentlemen make of it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Could be anything... Men in isolation... some beef that snowballed... got out of hand...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe the whole camp got bent... Something they ate. What about food poisoning, Doc?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER Maybe.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER There's something else we want you to see.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Dr. Copper and MacReady begin dumping the heavy contents of a large plastic trash bag onto the slab.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Displayed on the slab is what appears to be the corpse of a man. Badly charred. What is left of the trousers and shoes of the bottom torso are ripped and split, as if his legs and feet had burst from the inside. His upper body is an almost undecipherable gnarled mass of protoplasmic mush. The head is strangely disfigured and looks larger than normal. It is situated not on its shoulders but near the abdomen. Tendon-like appendages are wrapped around the carcass and sticking up and out in odd postures. One is wrapped around the body's left leg. The shirt has been ripped and lies shredded in the tar-like mess. The men grimace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blair, sickened but fascinated, pokes at the tendon-like things and the tarry goo.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER We found this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER I know he's pretty badly burned... but could fire have done this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER Blair, I'd like you and Fuchs to help me with autopsies on this one and the one Garry shot this morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: LATER - CLOSE ON A TABLE HOCKEY GAME Foosball. Nauls and Clark are going at it hot and heavy. Sanchez sits off in a corner thumbing through an old issue of Photoplay. Bennings, Norris and Garry are engaged in a card game. Bennings is about to play a card when he feels something under the table. He looks. It is the dog.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Clark, will you put this mutt with the others where he belong?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: larger than most of the other rooms and well-equipped. Dr. Copper is performing an autopsy on the Norwegian intruder, killed early that morning. Blair sits over his microscope, while Fuchs prepares slides. The other body is draped with a sheet, waiting its turn. Dr. Copper pulls off his gloves.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER Nothing wrong with this one. Physiologically, anyway. (to Blair) Find anything toxic?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No drugs... alcohol. Nothing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Clark leads the dog through the long, cold tunnel toward the kennel. A new dressing has been placed on its hip. He unlatches the door to the kennel and leads him in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About twenty feet long, five feet wide. Poorly lit. Cramped with dogs. Some of them sleeping. Others pacing around and curious, greet their new companion, sniffing, panting and rubbing up against him. Clark pats the dog and several others, then leaves, latching the door behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs lies in his cot watching a small television. The show is a tape of an American TV game show. He has seen this one too many times, extracts the cassette and injects another game show. Palmer is stretched out in the other cot, reading a comic book and smoking a joint. Childs beckons for it and takes a hit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A small area, just off the rec room. Set up like a bar. MacReady is alone looking over the rest of the videotapes from the Norwegian outpost. Mundane to esoteric chores of Antarctic camp life. He looks bored.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blair, hovering over the microscope, lays in a slide, focuses and motions for Dr. Copper to take a look. Copper is confused as he examines. He shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuchs takes the opportunity to look. Blair moves over to the disfigured corpse and indicates one of the fibrous, tendon- like appendages.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuchs is befuddled as he examines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Copper undoes his lab coat and lays it over a chair as he exits. Blair stares down ominously at the mutilated body.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER I don't understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's tissue from one of these sinewy rods.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What in the world kind of cell structure is this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's the point.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER (tired) I don't get you, Blair.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not sure it is any kind of cell structure. Biologically speaking.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER (sighing) This really isn't my field, Blair. Let's wrap for the day.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A steady stream of sleet pounds the compound and small surrounding shacks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vacant. The wall clock reads four-thirty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sleeping cubicles on either side. The sound of snoring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bleary-eyed, MacReady is in the process of blowing up some strange inflatable object. As he puffs away, he still keeps an eye on the Norwegian video tapes. His balloon begins to take shape. It blossoms into a life-size replica of a full- breasted woman. Something on the tape catches his eye. He rewinds, then starts it forward again. The screen shows the Norwegians on the surface of what appears to be an enormous, flat glacier. They are spread out on the ice around a large odd oval shape; their arms outstretched. It fades to black and then a Norwegian comes on mugging childishly in front of the camera, apparently quite pleased with something. The tape fades to black again and the picture reappears. This time they have marked off the large oval area with flag sticks. Closer shots show three of the men digging a deep hole into the ice. There is a small patch of something dark and metallic at the bottom. MacReady leans forward, intrigued. The men are now sinking something deep into the ice at various points around the markings. MacReady squints and mumbles to himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The tape jump cuts again showing a long shot of the markings. No Norwegian in sight. An explosion kicks up the ice. A beat as the ice sprays to the ground. Then the camera appears to shake as the ground beneath it quivers. Another immense explosion follows. An earthquake-like force throws the camera to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The tape continues, distorted, unviewable. A distinct crack in the lens. MacReady lets go of his companion and quickly rewinds. The deflating mannequin is sent sputtering around the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Decanite...? Thermite charges...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What in...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Most of the dogs are sleeping or lounging. The new dog watches them calmly, silently. He takes several steps towards a group of about five dogs and sits upright. Completely still. He stares at them. A beat. The dogs are aware of something. They begin to seem a bit confused, uncomfortable. The new dog continues to stare. Sitting rigidly, unnaturally still. His eyes dead, lusterless black spheres. Bewildered, a few dogs start to pace. As if sensing something: a portent. A danger. But so odd. They begin a soft, purring growl. The new dog remains a statue. The growling builds. More dogs begin to pace. Nervously. Faster, encircling. Emitting hisses, snarls. The lack of response driving them into a frenzy. Barks. Growls. More frenetic pacing. The din escalating. Three dogs start to close in on the stranger. They attack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: against the kennel wall. The shadow suddenly lurches upward, seeming larger. The kennel roars.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE SHADOW OF THE NEW DOG

direction.raw_text: MacReady is still going over bits of the same footage, fascinated. He hears the far-off clamor of the dogs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He, too, bothered by the noise, tosses and turns in his sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clark snores. MacReady has entered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No response. MacReady nudges him. Clark rolls away, annoyed. MacReady pinches his snoring nose, cutting off the air. Clark sits up, groggy.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Clark.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dogtown's going nuts. Take care of it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Clark, sleepy, irritated, makes his way down the freezing corridor. The wind soughing loudly overhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: reaches the kennel door. The savage outpouring of noise from within baffles and angers him. He unlatches the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smack! Just as he opens the door, two dogs, as if jettisoned from a cannon, knock him off his feet. Growls, barks, snarls. And a screeching from within.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What's got into...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: MacReady is fetching himself a beer. The sound of the far- off screeching. He freezes. A beat. He turns and sprints.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as it smashes the glass of the fire alarm. He pulls the lever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The alarm is blaring throughout the camp. MacReady, Garry, Norris run through the narrow tunnel led by Clark. MacReady carries a shotgun. Garry, half-dressed, has his .44. Clark, a fire ax.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know what the hell's in there, but it's weird and pissed off, whatever it is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Chaos. Men, half-naked, bounce from their cubicle. Pulling on their pants, digging into shoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs is grappling with his belt buckle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bennings is off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mac wants the what?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (at the doorway) That's what he said. Now! Move!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as the men approach the locked kennel door. The two dogs, thrown into Clark, back ferociously and scratch at the door trying to get back in. One is badly bloodied. The fight inside rages on. MacReady and Clark brace themselves by the narrow door. Norris and Garry hold back the two hysterical dogs. Clark undoes the latch and he and MacReady enter the kennel. The light has been broken and it is pitch black. MacReady snaps on his flashlight. Norris and Garry can't contain their animals and the dogs burst into the room. They smash into MacReady and send him sprawling. Total confusion: the dogs; the men; the screeching; the blackness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady gropes for his flashlight and rights himself. He finds Clark. Then shines it around the cramped room trying to get his bearings. The light finds a mass of dogs in a wild melee in the corner. Barking mixed with hissing, a gurgling, a screeching. Dogs being hurled about and then charging back into the fray with a vengeance. The flashlight illuminates parts of some "thing." A dog. But not quite. Impossible to tell. It struggles powerfully. Garry pokes his head into the blackness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady aims his shotgun at the entire pack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clark wades into the pack, grabs at dogs' hides and throws them back. He then wields his ax into the fray, chopping and hacking away at the gurgling, hissing silhouette. From out of nowhere, a large, bristly, arachnid-like leg springs up and wraps around Clark's ax. It sends Clark smashing violently into the wall.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mac, where are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's going on, damn it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going to shoot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No! Wait!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: More men running, nearing the kennel. Several squeezing in with Garry, trying to get a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady fires several rounds. A dog is flung at him, knocking him and his flashlight once more to the ground. Garry squeezes in and begins blasting away in the direction of the hissing and screeching. A dog is hit. MacReady crawls for his flashlight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blam. Blam. Garry continues firing at the silhouette.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Clark? Where are you? Clark!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Childs, huffing and puffing, lugs the huge industrial torch toward the crowded kennel doorway.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What's happening?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Childs, you got the torch? You get your ass in here!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Childs scrunches in, disoriented by the blackness, and bumps into Garry, knocking him off balance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady signals with his flashlight and then points it at the gathering of snarling dogs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs lets loose with a burst of blue flame. A mewing, a screeching. Part of the kennel starts to burn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs moves closer, continuing his assault on the hissing, gurgling presence. Men charge into the room and begin spraying dogs and burning walls. Dogs and men choke and cough amidst the smoke and CO2. The screeching lessens. The hissing and gurgling fade. Childs turns off his torch.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Torch it over there!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The dogs?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Screw the dogs!! Torch it!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (panic) We're on fire!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't let up, Childs!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to outside) Extinguishers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Those of the men that have gathered exhibit a pale and quiet uneasiness. Blair, in silent awe, stands over the badly burned corpses of two interlocking dogs, that lie before him on a table. They are connected as if they were one animal. Though, the one wearing the remnants of Clark's bandage is much larger and appears less dog-like. Its entire torso is cracked and peeled, as if its innards were trying to burst out. Odd appendages, recoiled and withered by the flame, are wrapped grotesquely about both bodies. Clark, his eyes set in glassy stare, sits in shock. Nauls comforts him. Childs stands nearby smoking a joint and staring at the floor. Blair, transfixed, continues hovering over the united cadavers. Weighing. Thinking. A very worried look on his face. The dead bodies of two other dogs from the kennel are not far off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuchs is attending to the shredded bodies of three other badly wounded dogs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nauls pats Clark on the shoulder and grins, trying to pick up his spirits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clark turns to him with a childlike smile.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's okay now, man. It's dead. It's over. (beat) You see.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know. Mr. Childs killed it. I saw.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right, man. Right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Norris is going through some maps. MacReady is bent over his shoulder. Norris finds the one he's looking for.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bennings pokes his head in the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Here. This is where they were spending most of their time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pretty nasty out, Mac. Thirty-five knots.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Screw it, I'm going up anyway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Station Manager Garry has joined Blair by the stuck-together bodies. Blair motions to the bandage.

dialogue.raw_text: Was that dog, the Norwegian dog?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just can't comprehend any of this. It was just a dog.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (evenly) "tweren't no dog, Bwana.

dialogue.raw_text: That tape MacReady showed us this morning...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Couldn't make much of it myself.

dialogue.raw_text: I've asked him to try and locate the site. Okay with you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure. You think there's a connection?

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe.

direction.raw_text: high above the Antarctic expanse.

direction.raw_text: MacReady pilots. Young Palmer and Norris are with him. It is clear but the winds are troublesome. The ride is a shaky one. Norris refers to their map. He points.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They aim for a large mountainous wall. As they go up and over... they see:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: One of their sites would be directly over here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: On the surface, an enormous blackened oval shape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .S. OUTPOST #31 - LAB All the bodies of the dogs have been brought in. Fuchs stands by as Blair studies through his microscope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of two cells. They appear to be much different from each other. They are joined at the ends but are completing the process of breaking off from each other.

direction.raw_text: A disturbed look on his face. He checks his watch, as if timing the procedure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as they walk along the ice. They come to a stop at the edge of a sharp drop. Pull back to reveal -- the massive black hole about fifteen feet beneath the ice. Charred, gnarled and mangled metal are all that is left of what was once an enormous sphere. MacReady's and Norris' eyes meet each other in silence. Palmer is in awe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady finds a burst thermite canister. He and Norris climb down. They move along amongst the wreck. Almost everything but the skeletal superstructure has disintegrated into a fine ashy powder. Norris digs for ice samples at the perimeter of the wreckage, while MacReady browses through the center. Palmer continues to marvel, as he walks around the oval, atop the ice. MacReady returns and kneels down next to Norris as the latter examines a piece of metal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norris shakes his head no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Palmer calls out, waving them over.

dialogue.raw_text: Wow...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Magnesium of some type... or some kind of strange alloy. (looks out at debris in disgust) And those poor dumb bastards had to go and blow the hell out of it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So what do you make of it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know damn well what we both make of it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No chance it could have been some new kind of test craft?

dialogue.raw_text: Seismic activity has been pushing this are up from way down for a long time... (holds up ice sample) ...This ice it was buried in... It's over a hundred thousand years old.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The two men join Palmer about fifty yards from the oval. A large rectangular chunk has been cut out of the ice. It is fifteen feet long, six feet wide and eight feet deep. MacReady kneels down to observe. A beat. A gust of wind picks up the snow at their feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fascinated, a few of the men are reviewing the Norwegian video tapes of the finding of the mysterious craft. MacReady sits quietly by his chess set contemplating a large glass of Scotch. Clark, less interested than the others, is flipping through the Norwegian nudie magazine. Blair, looking worried, sits off in a corner, pondering the photo of the block of ice and fingering a piece of crumbled- up metal brought back from the site. Childs, viewing the tapes, can't quite believe it all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady is not listening.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Okay now, Mac, run this by me again. Thousands of years ago this rocket ship crashes, right...? And the...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: MacReady!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, I'm just guessing...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, go on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Nauls, about to prepare dinner, scowls as he rummages through his many cabinets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns to examine the cabinets above the large stove. He spots something in the nearby kitchen trash can. Disgusted, he pulls out a torn and shredded pair of long johns.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where's that big ol' steel pot of mine?! Damn!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: MacReady theorizes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blair says nothing, lost in thought. Palmer, stoned, a joint dangling from his mouth, is searching for information through stacks of old issues of The National Enquirer and The Star.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Palmer shakes a magazine at him adamantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clark marvels at a particular photo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nauls skates into the room. He shakes the crumpled-up pair of long johns in his fist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He flings it across the room. It lands on MacReady's chess set.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nauls spins on his skates and storms off. MacReady fetches the strangely shredded underwear and rolls it up, while Childs paces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady tosses the ball of cloth across the room into a trash bin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beat as Blair stares straight ahead, transfixed. He speaks softly, to no one particular.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men take in his grave countenance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blair turns to them. A pause. The men search his face.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...So it crashes, and this guy, whoever he is, gets thrown out, or walks out, and ends up freezing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just can't believe this voodoo bullshit. You believe this voodoo bullshit, Blair?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rambling) Happens all the time, man. They're falling out of the skies like flies. Government knows all about it... Chariots of the Gods, man... They practically own South America. I mean they taught the Incas everything they knew...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cool it, Palmer!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Read von Daniken! Have you read von Daniken? Get your facts straight!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus, why would those guys ever want to leave Norway...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Which one you muthers been tossing his dirty underwear in the kitchen trash?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want my kitchen clean. Germ free!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So, MacReady, come on now. These Norwegian dudes come by... find him and dig him up...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, they dig him up and cart him back. He gets thawed out, wakes up and scares the shit out of them. And they get into one hell of a brawl...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now how's this motherfucker wake up after thousands of years in the ice, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (annoyed) I don't know how. Because he's different than we are. Because he's a space guy. What do you want from me, anyway. Go ask Blair.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You buy any of this, Blair?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was here... got to that dog... It was here in this camp...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So...? So what? It's over with.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (edgy) Well, isn't it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as Blair rips it off exposing the tangled mess of interlocking dogs. Pull back. All the men have gathered. Some of the men settle into chairs, others stand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blair slams his fist on the slab.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Several of the men nearest the carcasses jump back knocking over a chair.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Whatever that Norwegian dog was... It... It was capable of changing its form... (indicates their dog) ...when it attacked our dog... it somehow was able to digest... or... absorb it... and in the process shaped its own cells to imitate our dog's cells exactly... (holds up gooey dog leg) ...This for instance isn't dog at all -- it's imitation... We got to it before it had time to finish or...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Finish what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...I think the whole process would have taken an hour... maybe more. And then I suppose both would have changed back to dog form.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, that Thing in the ice sure weren't no dog.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (impatient) Of course not... But whatever it was revived, it... Well, The Thing was probably disoriented... and realized it couldn't survive for long in our atmosphere... But being the incredibly adaptable creature it was... it tried to become something that could... Before the Norwegians killed it... it somehow got to this dog.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean "got" to the dog?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was a life form that was able to imitate and reproduce, whatever it ate or absorbed, cell for cell.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The concept is staggering. I know... I... I don't fully understand it myself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (skeptically, points) You're saying... that big muther in the ice, became the dog.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nodding) I think we're talking about an organism... that could imitate other life forms... perfectly... It could have gone on and on... It could have become one dog... It could have become as many dogs as it wanted to -- and without losing any of its original mass...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You been into Childs' weed, Blair?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, I know it's hard to believe...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (breaking in) So what's our problem?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well... there's still some cell activity... it's not entirely dead yet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: NIGHT - CLOSE ON THE DOG CARCASSES lying on the snow. Splash. They are being soaked with gasoline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pull back. Fuchs is beside himself. Childs has the large torch. MacReady empties another can on the bodies. Dr. Copper stands nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs lights the tip. Fuchs makes a determined move for the torch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs struggles with him for a beat and then flings him to the ground. Dr. Copper grabs him preventing him from getting back up. Childs splays the remains with a jet of flame. Fuchs shakes his head in frustration and disgust.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (in violent protestation) You can't do this! You can't burn these remains...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And the horse you rode in on, Fuchs. (to Childs) Light it up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I'm not going to let this happen...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just can't believe it... We're going to go down as the biggest bunch of assholes in history...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fuck history. At least we're going to live to be an old bunch of assholes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The night feeding. Clark dishes out the food. Blair is taking blood samples from the remaining three dogs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beat as Blair stares at Clark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clark seems uneasy under Blair's intense gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blair stands, his eyes still glued to Clark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blair's eyes glaze as if in revelation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He backs out of the kennel.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (perplexed, bothered) Clark, did you notice anything strange about that dog? Just anything at all? Any little thing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. Just that he recovered real quick... That night when I found him in the rec room, he had already scraped off his bandage. Before I put him with the others, I redressed his wound and noticed it had healed up real good...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That night?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pets dog vigorously) Yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What was he doing in the rec room?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, after I worked on him -- thought I'd let him rest. Left the room for a bit. When I came back, he was gone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, where was he? Where did he go?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't know. Looked for him for a bit... couldn't find him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a long beat) You're saying he wasn't put into the kennel until the night?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well... yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How long were you with the dog? Alone, I mean?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah... He was hurt bad. Bullet nicked an artery... I don't know... An hour... hour and a half...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell you looking at me like that for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing. Nothing at all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Irritated, distressed, station manager Garry moves briskly down the hall. Blair, worried and pale, tries to keep up with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Garry stops at the entrance to the communications room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sanchez shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bennings interrupts, entering the hallway, referring to his meteorological chart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men outside come stomping through the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! You can't let people leave...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't going anywhere in anything over forty knots, Garry... GARRY (snapping) The hell you won't, MacReady!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Close on Blair, ashen-faced, falling silent. As if in a daze, he watches the men as they continue to converse. Suspicious, frightened.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...It could have gotten to somebody...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anybody sick?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I... I don't mean infection... or disease...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Any luck yet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Couple seconds of an Argentine disco station.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, stick with it. I want you at it round the clock. We got to get help in here...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (alarm) No... No, you can't let anyone in here... That dog was all over this camp...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Garry) Travel-wise, tomorrow may be okay. But after that some pretty nasty northeasterly shit's coming in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Goddamn fools...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pleading) Listen to me, Garry. Please...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to MacReady) If the weather clears enough before we reach anybody -- I'm sending you and Doc up to MacMurdo...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't you understand?! That Thing didn't want to become a dog...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (fed up) Damn you, Blair! You've already got everybody half-hysterical around here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't let anybody leave!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've got six dead Norwegians on my hands, a burned up flying saucer, and we've just destroyed the scientific find of the century. Now fuck off!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Pitch black except for the barest of lighting which outlines the building. Wind. The swirl of ice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Far away from the others, MacReady sits in his little hovel putting the final screw into his mended chess set. On the other side of the set, his busty, inflatable companion has been propped up in a chair. His sombrero hangs down her back, keeping her in place. Hawaiian music plays from his tape deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He puts down his screwdriver, holds up his glass and offers a toast with a big grin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He clinks the drink he has made for her that rests on her side of the board. He sips. He turns on the machine and makes his first move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The set answers for Esperanza.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He flips open the circuitry panel in disgust. He tosses his screwdriver on the board and grabs his drink, downing it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He reaches inside his ice bucket. Empty.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: All set.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now go easy on me, Esperanza. I'm just a beginner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Rook takes bishop at Queen four -- Rook take pawn at Queen two -- Rook takes Queen at Queen one -- Checkmate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aw shit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry, hon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Never any damn ice around here...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: MacReady exits. He swacks at a nearby bank of ice with a small ice pick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sound of a clanking. He turns his attention. Metal against metal. Strange. MacReady listens. It appears to be coming from far off below, near the camp.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Now in Mexico... Tahiti... They got ice... They got ice coming out of their ears.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as he makes his way down with the aid of the steadying ropes. The clanking louder now. He senses the direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: at the bottom near the main compound.  The sound has stopped. He looks around in the near blackness.  A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sitting idle in the dark. MacReady approaches. The door to one of the cockpits is slightly ajar. He opens it cautiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady slips in. He turns on a flashlight. The controls have been mangled. Beaten with something heavy. Bang!! MacReady, startled, turns. Like the sound of a gun. Coming from the main compound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Confusion. Shouts. MacReady enters. He grabs Palmer as he and Bennings rush by.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What's...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Blair. He's gone berserk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's in the radio room. Got a gun. Beat on Sanchez something fierce.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - RADIO ROOM ENTRANCE The men are on either side of the open radio room doorway. Garry peeks his head in. A gunshot blast forces him back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sanchez lies on the floor, groaning. Blair holds the gun on the door. He wields a fire ax with the other hand and smashes down on the radio.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Anybody interferes, I'll kill! Nobody's getting in or out of this camp...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: MacReady has joined the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs is off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He smashed one of the choppers up good. Childs, go check the other one and the tractor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Blair crunches the ax down once again, while keeping an eye on the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...You think I'm crazy? Fine! Most of you don't know what's going on -- but I'm damn well sure some of you do! (crunch)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The back window. A couple of us could maybe surprise him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Too damn dangerous.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ...You think this Thing wants to become an animal? Dogs can't make it 1000 miles to the sea. No skua gulls to imitate this time of year... No penguins this far inland... Don't you understand?! It wanted to become us! He brings the ax down hard on the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs runs up, out of breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Garry readies his large .357 Magnum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norris double-times down the hall. MacReady turns the corner and into the rec room. He grabs one of the thick card tables. MacReady returns with the table to the hallway.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He got both choppers and the tractor... I don't know how bad yet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, wait a minute. (to Norris) The fuse box.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Can't you see...? If one cell of this Thing got out it could imitate every living thing on Earth. Nothing could stop it! Nothing!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (humoring) Look Blair, maybe you're right about this. But we've got to be rational. We've got to talk this over. I'm unarmed and I'm coming in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, you're not! I don't trust any of you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: reaches the fuse box. He opens it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady readies the table like a shield.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lights go out. MacReady charges into the black room. Blair fires. MacReady barrels into him, knocking him to the ground. He pummels him with a right hand and manages to control the gun. The others dive in and pile on.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: If you're right we've all got to stick together.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Heavily-clothed, MacReady, Fuchs and Dr. Copper help a dazed Blair to a toolshed some seventy-five yards from the main compound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More spacious than MacReady's. Very livable. Two windows. Blair has been placed on the cot. Dr. Copper injects him with a sedative.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Why am I here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER It's for your own protection, Blair.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And mainly ours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Fuchs and MacReady nail boards over the windows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blair's droopy-eyed, heavily drugged features loom up at MacReady through the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blair's face disappears from the window.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Leave a bit of an opening so he can see out.
dialogue.name: dialogue
