dialogue.raw_text: How you doin', old boy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) I don't know who to trust.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (humoring) Know what you mean, Blair. Trust is a tough thing to come by these days. Just trust in the Lord.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (beat) Watch Clark.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Watch him close. Ask him why he didn't kennel the dog.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Harsh and grey. Getting very dark as winter takes a stronger hold. Bennings is dumping the trash in a large hole in the snow which acts as the trash dump. Bennings finishes and drags the empty bins past Palmer and Childs, who are fixing the wounded choppers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The radio looks a mess. Norris and Sanchez, a bandage wrapped around his head, examines the damage. He is in pain and still looks a little groggy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norris smiles and pats him comfortingly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'll see what I can do. But they didn't teach me much about fixing these things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They didn't teach you much about working them either.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . Pull back. The men help themselves. It is a cramped, elongated room. Dr. Copper approaches Nauls and hands him a capsule.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clark comes running into the room, pallid, out of breath. The men turn to look.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER Put this in Blair's juice before you take him his tray.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The dogs...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Empty. Clark and Garry examine the latch of the kennel door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Doesn't look broken.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. Door was wide open. I know I latched it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . COMPOUND ABOVE THE UNDERGROUND KENNEL CLOSE ON THE DOGS' TRACKS in the snow. They lead from the kennel's open stairwell and out onto the ice. All the men have gathered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady is writing down what appears to be a list on a pad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Garry and several others turn to MacReady quizzically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady hands his list to Bennings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He puts his arm around Childs and pulls him along. The others watch them walk off, a little bewildered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bennings is reading MacReady's list.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: All three of them took off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER How long do you suppose they've been gone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I haven't seen them since their last feeding. Could be as much as twenty- four hours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They couldn't have gotten that far in this weather.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're not thinking of going after them, are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am going after them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What in the hell for? Even if Blair's right -- they'll just die out there. No food. They're over a thousand miles from anything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Chopper aren't going to be ready for days.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get these things out of supply and meet me over by the snowmobiles.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're not going to catch them in one of those with the start they got.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Palmer, how long would it take you to strap those big four-cylinder carburetors on?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grins) Oh, I got you. Not too long.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then get a move on. Childs, come with me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouting after them) Besides, what are you going to do when you catch up to them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Holy shit. (hands list to Garry) Whatever he's going to do, he ain't fucking around.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of the large torch. A fierce stream of flame bursts from its nozzle. Pull back. The stream has shot out some fifteen feet. Childs has been modifying it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I can get maybe another five or six feet out of it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's good enough.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as he works on the snowmobiles. Into frame rolls a wheelbarrow on sleds. A box marked DYNAMITE is its most prominent article. Pull back. Bennings reads off the list of supplies.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: All right... Box of dynamite... box of thermite... three shotguns... box of flares... two flare guns... thirty cans gasoline... and a case of alcohol.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's load 'em.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The two vehicles rip across the hard, flat ice, bolstered by the added horsepower. They follow the still visible dog tracks in the snow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sliding across the horizon, signaling midday. The snowmobiles whoosh past. Bennings drives the one loaded with supplies. MacReady and Childs double up on the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: steadying his binoculars, while Childs drives, spots something up ahead. The vehicles slow down and come to a halt. Something lies just ahead of them in the whiteness, in the middle of the dog tracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: kneel down by the "something." It is the half-eaten remains of a dog. Its hind legs and lower stomach picked clean. Its ripped hide, flapping in the wind. Its top half missing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady follows the line of continuing dog tracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady moves to the snowmobile and grabs a two-gallon can of gasoline. He turns to Bennings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beat as MacReady takes this in. He pours the gas over the remains and sets it aflame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs and Bennings are not that anxious to continue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady gets on and revs up the engine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs and Bennings return shrugs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe dinner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dogs don't eat each other.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (beat) I know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's the other half?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Probably the next meal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where these tracks headed?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nowhere... Just straight to the ocean.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's move.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They could be hours ahead of us, Mac.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gonna get dark soon, too. Supposed to be fifty below tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Turn back if you want.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: making its last pass, rolling off the horizon. Only a slight orange hue left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: move slower, positioned on either side of the tracks. The tracks abruptly change direction. The men come to a stop. It is much colder now. Their beards, a mask of white powder. MacReady surveys the new direction. They are headed toward a far-off ridge of bluffs. Large, windswept mounds of ice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as they move through a valley of newly-formed dunes and tall ice cliffs. The last of the sun obscured, the headlamps are turned on and pointed at the tracks. The men look behind, in front, and from side to side, as they proceed cautiously through the maze. Up ahead MacReady spots:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It sits, its back to them, unconcerned, heedless of their arrival. It is munching on the other half of the dog carcass. The men stop their machines some twenty yards from it. They are hemmed in at the valley's narrowest point. Childs, carrying the torch, and MacReady, armed with a thermite bomb, wade awkwardly but carefully toward the animal in their snowshoes. Bennings stands back by the snowmobiles. Childs and MacReady spread out some dozen feet from the dog. It continues to pay them no mind, content to chew its food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bennings surveys the tops of the snow bluffs that encircle them with his flashlight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No response. MacReady searches the near vicinity with his light. All three are growing uneasy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs turns on the gas and lights the tip. Bennings is still watching the bluffs. Something from beneath the snow reaches up and grabs his feet. He is ripped back down through the hard snow in one incredibly powerful motion. He screams, his head the only thing sticking out of the ice. Childs and MacReady turn, confused, unable to see anything be Bennings' screaming head. They rush toward him. MacReady stumbles. The sound of a snapping, a crackling to MacReady's rear. He freezes; turns back to the dog. Its back is still to him; its coat of hair sticking up like that of a porcupine. It snarls; its face turns slowly toward him. Its skin splitting; its mouth ripping open wildly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs stops, confused as to who to help first. He notices the dog hunched and ready to spring. He steps back toward MacReady. The dog/Thing leaps for MacReady; an incredible jump of some twenty feet. Childs lets loose a blast, hitting the dog in midair; the force of the spray knocking it back and tumbling to the ice in flames. MacReady throws his thermite canister. It discharges and engulfs the screeching animal in fire.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where's the other one?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to dog) Where's your buddy, boy? Huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let that thing fly, Childs. Don't let up until he's ash.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Childs!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: howling in pain. The ice underneath him thrashes violently. Childs and MacReady stand by helplessly, unable to see what has him or what action to take. Childs moves closer to help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bennings' head disappears with a sudden jerk through the ice. The ice continues to rumble like boiling water, moving in different directions. Part of Bennings' body pops up in a different area and is just as quickly pulled back down. MacReady and Childs watch on in frustration and anger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bennings' head and shoulders then surface near one of the snowmobiles. Something has him. Unclear as to what. The jowls of a dog. But huge. Bennings' heavy clothing begins to rip, tear, as if his skin underneath was bulging out. The jowls seem to be absorbing his head. MacReady runs for the snowmobile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs blasts away. The ice begins to melt as Bennings and whatever has him catch fire. A screeching. MacReady grabs cans of gas from the snowmobiles. Suddenly a steel-like, arachnid-shaped arm shoots out in pain and with incredible force pierces the fiberglass chassis of the snowmobile. MacReady is knocked back. He recovers and dumps cans of gasoline on the writhing mess. He dives and rolls away from the lunging appendage. He and Childs watch on as Bennings and The Thing roar in flame. Behind them, the other dog/Thing continues to burn. The screeching, mewing and gurgling wails on, all about them. They look to each other in disbelief, their faces illuminated by the flickering flames. The strident sounds beginning to subside.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (pulls him back) Stay back!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What we going to do?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How the fuck do I know?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Torch them!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's gone already! Do it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Its slim, orange arc sets, signaling the start of the Vernal Equinox. And the beginning of six months of darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men are interrogating Clark. He is frazzled and defensive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs is holding the industrial torch directly in his face.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...I'm telling you I don't remember leaving the kennel unlatched...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bullshit! You left it open so they could get out!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: MacReady, waist-deep in trash and snow, searches for something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The interrogation continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs grabs him by the collar and rips him off his chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nauls steps between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Garry breaks it up, pulling them apart. MacReady enters from the outside. A bundle is tucked under his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady moves over to the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norris shakes his head, rubbing his chest in slight discomfort.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady pushes his sombrero back over his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He drops the bundle he had been holding on the table between the men. It is the shredded pair of long johns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men look from one another. Silence. MacReady picks it up and examines the label.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clark stews.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The uneasiness in the room grows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pause as all eyes travel from man to man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norris turns to Dr. Copper and Fuchs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Garry unhinges a key from his belt and hands it to Dr. Copper. Dr. Copper and Fuchs head for the infirmary.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...Would I even have told you they were gone if I had anything to hide?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But why didn't you kennel that dog right away?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I told you I couldn't find... (pushes torch away) ...get that out of my face.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't you be telling me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Childs) Lighten your load, sucker. You ain't the judge and executioner around here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who you trying to protect, mutherfucker? I'm telling you this S.O.B. could be one of them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hold on, damn it. We're getting nowhere... If this bit of Blair's about absorbing and imitating is true... then that dog could have gotten to anybody.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER And if it got to Clark... Clark could have gotten to anybody.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER Theoretically any of us could be whatever the hell this thing is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's just too damn wild -- I can't believe it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, you can believe it now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nauls found this yesterday. It's ripped just like the clothing on the Norwegian we brought back. The same thing was happening to Bennings' clothes when it got to him. Seems these Things don't imitate clothes. Just flesh and bone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Size large. (grins) What do you wear, Clark?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wear a size large, too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So do I. So do most of us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Doubt if it got to more than one or two of us. But it got to someone. (beat) Somebody in this room ain't what he appears to be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (scared) Well, what we going to do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can there be... some kind of test? To find out who's what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER A serum test possibly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right. Why not?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER It's a simple blood typing test. This Thing's blood chemistry is different than ours. Basically we mix someone's blood with uncontaminated human blood. If we don't get the proper serum reaction -- then that person isn't human.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whose uncontaminated blood we going to use?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER We've got blood plasma in storage.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How long will it take you to prepare this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER A couple of hours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, get to it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How's that Thing get to the dogs? I though we stopped it in time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Copper thinks they swallowed pieces of it during the fight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And that was enough?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER (O.S.) Garry. The rest of you! Come here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The men rush in. Fuchs and Copper stand by the open plasma storage refrigerator. The inside is a mess of dried blood. The bladders have been ripped open. Copper is ghastly pale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A horrified silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sanchez twitches, terrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Several pairs of eyes turn to Garry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Garry senses the nervous and inquiring eyes on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Silence as the men continue to stare. Sanchez is perspiring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The eyes shift from Garry to Copper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sanchez bolts out the door. Stunned for a beat, the others chase after him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER Somebody got to the blood... sabotaged it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, my God.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Was it broken into?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. Somebody opened it. Closed it. And then locked it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, who's got access to it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER I guess I'm the only one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I've got the only key.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would that test have worked?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER I think so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Somebody else sure as hell thought so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who else could have used that key?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah... no one... I give it to Copper when he needs it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Could anyone have gotten it from you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER I don't see how... when I'm finished I return it right away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When was the last time you used it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER (uneasy) A day or so ago... I guess.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I suppose... well, it's possible someone might have lifted it from me. But...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That key ring of yours is always hooked to your belt. Now how could somebody get to it without you knowing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (upset, flustered) Look, I haven't been near that... that refrigerator.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Copper's the only one who has any business with it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER Now... wait a second, Garry, you've been in here on several occasions...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And the Doc thought of the test.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (anger) So what?! Is that supposed to leave him in the clear?! Bullshit!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Sanchez!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: in terror, runs at top speed through the narrow corridors. Opening and shutting doors. The others are in pursuit. They shout for him to stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as he reaches a small armory. A glass case set into the wall. A half dozen rarely used guns are inside. He tries the handle. Locked. He hears the clamor of feet and voices as the others are nearing. He breaks the glass and grabs a shotgun. Then a box of shells. He frantically tries to load, but is too nervous. The others arrive at the end of the hallway. Garry pulls his handgun and points.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one doubts Garry's sincerity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The other regard Garry tensely. No one oblivious to the fact, that Sanchez just might be right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still trembling, he tosses the shells back into the broken case, leans the gun against the wall and begins to sob. Nauls skates over to comfort him. The men watch as Garry lowers his gun. He turns to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hands his gun to Norris.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs goes for the gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady beats him to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs glares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roving eyes pass about the hallway. Nobody is sure who to trust. MacReady seems as good as any.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Put that down!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (trembling) No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll put this right through your head.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You guys going to let him give orders? I mean he could be one of those Things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calm) Put it away, Sanchez. Just put it away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know about Copper. But I didn't go near that plasma... (beat) But I guess you'll all rest easier if someone else is in charge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can't see anyone objecting to you, Norris.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry, gentlemen... (rubs chest) ...Don't think I'd be up to it. Haven't been feeling well lately.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll take it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe it should be someone a bit more even-tempered, Childs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to others) ...Any objections?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The men have gathered to discuss plans. Furtive and untrustworthy glances are passed around the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs points to Garry, Dr. Copper and Clark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuchs nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Palmer is ignored.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Copper eyes his accuser solemnly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...From what we know this Thing likes to go one on one. So we stick together as much as possible. In two's and three's.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do we do about those three?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We got morphine, don't we.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, we keep them loaded. Stash them here in the rec room and watch 'em twenty-four hours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (ears perk up) Morphine? You know I was pretty close to that dog, too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We should sleep in shifts.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right. Half of us awake at all times.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How we going to try and find out who's... you know, who's who?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Fuchs) Can you think of any other tests?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll try.  I could sure use Copper's help though.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can eighty-six that thought right now, man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Also... When this Thing turns... it turns slowly at first. I think we can handle it in that state. But if it ever got to full power... from what I saw of that Norwegian camp... well, I just don't know... It would probably take it an hour or more to get like that. So no matter what anybody's doing, we all return to this room every twenty minutes. Anybody gone longer than that... anybody trying to leave... we kill 'em.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It is the dead of winter. Six months of darkness ahead. Palmer fights the cold as he works dismantling the engine of the helicopter. He frowns, searching for something.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (mumbles) Where's that magneto? Can't find a darn thing around here any more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Copper, Clark and Garry sit moodily together on a couch. Norris awkwardly prepares to give them their injections. He is new at this. Childs stands guard with his torch. Dr. Copper offers to help.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER I'll do it. You're going to break the needle in my arm.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, Doc. He's doing a real fine job.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: MacReady and Sanchez are foraging through the trash dump.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Look for shoes, too. And burned cloth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Norris has begun dismantling the radio. He rubs at his chest as he disengages the headset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Following Nauls as he skates through the labyrinth. Checking waste bins. Pausing to look behind shelves and any obscure hiding place. MacReady passes him coming the other way.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That thing's too smart to be hiding any more of its clothes, MacReady.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just keep looking.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Fuchs is poring over a book. Several others lie open on his desk. MacReady pokes his head in the lab.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How's it going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing yet. But, MacReady, I've been thinking... If our dogs changed by swallowing parts of that other one... We better see to it that everyone prepares their own food and we eat out of cans.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gotchya.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A siren goes off, signaling the end of a twenty-minute period. Sanchez pulls himself out of the trash dump. Palmer carries a large part of a helicopter engine toward the compound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hallway near the supply storage cubicle. MacReady holds the door open as Palmer makes his way to him lugging the heavy helicopter part. Childs passes by from the other direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He passes by.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Childs, where's that magneto from Chopper One?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ain't it there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No it ain't there. Would I be asking if it were there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Move it, Palmer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Palmer sets down the heavy part. Norris follows him inside with a bundle of radio gear. They move back out into the hallway. MacReady locks the door behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The three move down the hall toward their appointed rendezvous at the rec room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Palmer) Start taking apart those snowmobiles next, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Cramped. Several of the men are preparing their food. Opening cans. Heating them in pots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nauls wearily approaches Blair's tool shed with a tray of food. He hears a pounding from within.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He peeks in through the opening in the boarded-up window. Blair is nailing himself in from the inside. He looks pretty crazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nauls slides the tray in the slot. It is immediately shoved back out and topples onto the ice. Some of the food has splashed on Nauls' heavy coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nauls picks up the tray, heads back mumbling.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I got your goodies, superdude.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What you doin'?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nobody's getting in here. You can tell them all that!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, who the hell you think wants to get in there with you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now why'd you go and...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I don't want any more food with sedatives in it. I know what you're up to. Don't think I don't. And if anyone tries to get in here -- I've got rope. I'll hang myself before it gets to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You promise?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Crazy white scientist motherfucker...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Palmer works on the snowmobile. Sanchez resumes searching through the trash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady slashes into the huge uninflated weather balloons, rendering them useless. Tanks of helium and hydrogen are stacked nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nauls does the dishes. His cassette plays in the b.g.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs continues guarding the three men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs follows him to the other end of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clark walks to the head. Childs moves back to the middle of the room. As the guard he is much more vulnerable in this position. Being split between his prisoners. The lights begin to flicker. The soft purr of the generator begins to fade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lights go out. Nauls calls from the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Copper giggles in the dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs lights the tip of his torch, allowing him a strong candlelight. Garry is no longer in the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Copper looks numbly at the empty seat next to him. Childs finds the portable siren and blares it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Gotta go to the can, Childs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Be quick.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, no.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Childs! That a fuse?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. The generator. You got the auxiliary box just off the kitchen. Get to it. (fumbling around) Where's the damn flashlight? (calling out) You fellas okay over there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cut that out, Copper. (beat) Nauls? What's taking you?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) I'm working it! Nothing's happening!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's impossible, man! Okay, Clark, out of the john where I can see you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) It's shorted out or something!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouting) Clark, you come on out here!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's... Where's Garry?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: MacReady, Palmer and Sanchez heed the call and head for the compound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs jerks his head around in different directions.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where are you, Garry? Don't you move an inch, Copper. (shouts) Nauls, bring me a goddamn flashlight!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Pitch black.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Somebody's taken it. I can't find it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Clark, you want me to come in after you?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: MacReady, Sanchez and Palmer come in from the outside. They bump into each other trying to get their bearings from the lack of light. Palmer, the only one who seems to have one, turns on his flashlight.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (shouting) What's happened?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) MacReady, that you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) It's the generator I think! No power.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Palmer) Well, let's get down there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) MacReady!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Garry's missing!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to self) Oh, shit! (shouts) Well, hang on!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Gee, thanks!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Palmer and MacReady stumbling down the stairs. MacReady turns around, looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Both look around. Sanchez is gone. Palmer's light finds the motionless generator. He examines it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady dashes upstairs into the darkness.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where's Sanchez?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The fuel pump... it's gone... (frantic) You've got to get up to supply, Mca. If we don't get this thing started soon, it'll freeze on us and we'll never get it going.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The lab door is opened. Fuchs holding a small candle walks out. As he passes, the shoulder of a man springs into frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Palmer is feverishly working underneath the generator on his back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The temperature continues to drop rapidly. Childs swats himself to keep warm, while still keeping an eye on Dr. Copper and the rest of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady rushes out of the supply room, with a fuel pump, bumps into somebody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The silhouette moves on down the hallway.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Who... Who is that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sanchez...?  Hey, who...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Mac, where the hell is that pump!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: MacReady holds the flashlight for Palmer. Their breath, puffs of white smoke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sound of a screeching. From somewhere in the compound. The two men's faces, locked in fear.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Somebody definitely messed with it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We going to make it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hope so. Another ten, fifteen minutes. What I don't get is...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The generator has been repaired; the lights within the compound are back on. Grim and tense. Everyone is present but Fuchs. Eyes flit from man to man. Palmer, Nauls and Sanchez are spread out about the room, keeping as much distance as possible from the rest. Norris and Childs are tying the Doctor, Clark and Garry to the couch. MacReady prepares several makeshift blowtorches as he kneels on the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No answer as the men's faces roam the room. Childs glares at Garry as he begins to tie him in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Garry's groggy features stare blankly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Garry struggles to his feet, affronted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He grabs Childs by the collar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs whales on him with a right hand. Both go tumbling over the couch. MacReady and Norris dive in breaking it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady, furious, pulls Childs away. Norris breathing heavily from the activity, massages his chest. The strong, stormy winds overhead batter the roofing. MacReady glances up. He and Childs release each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He thrusts one of the blowtorches hard into Childs' stomach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tosses torches to Sanchez and Palmer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sanchez snaps his head toward Palmer. Palmer looks at the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men survey each other.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where were the flashlights?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Screw the flashlights. Where the hell were you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tons of stuff's been missing around here. Magnetos, cables, wire...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kitchen things, too...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anybody see Fuchs... or hear him...? Huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where'd you go?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I said where? Where'd you go?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Was dark... find a light...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You lying bastard...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (slurring) I rather don't like your tone...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You sit back down...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Enough...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That storm's going to start ripping any minute -- so we don't have much time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've got to find Fuchs. When we find him -- we kill him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If he's one of those Things, we've got to get to him before he changes... Nauls, you and Childs and I'll check the outside shacks...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sanchez, you and Palmer search the inside...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I ain't going with Sanchez.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I ain't going with him. I'll go with Childs...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, screw you, man!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I ain't going with you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, who says I want you going with me?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cut the bullshit... Okay, Sanchez, you come with us. Norris... you stay here... (refers to tied-up men) Any of them move -- you fry 'em. And if you hear anything, anything at all you let loose the siren. We all meet back here in twenty minutes regardless. (a beat) And everybody watch whoever you're with. Real close.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's move.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: MacReady and Nauls, wearing their snowshoes and using flares for light, pull themselves along the steadying rope that leads to Blair's shed. They are careful to keep an eye on each other as they move along. Sanchez heads off in the direction of another shack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of the many doors creak open. Childs and Palmer stealthily move into the next corridor. Palmer falls a few steps behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs freezes and snaps his head around facing Palmer. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He moves to the other side of the wall, parallel with Childs. They continue on, skimming along the sides of the corridor in plain view of one another.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What'd we ever do to these Things anyway...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't walk behind me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Nauls and MacReady arrive at Blair's shack. They peer in through the spaces between the boards. A weak light burns as Blair is seated eating out of a can. A hangman's noose dangles from the ceiling nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blair jumps in fear, spilling his can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blair approaches the boarded-up window. He looks haggard and afraid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He and Nauls trudges off. Blair shouts after them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Blair!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Has Fuchs been out here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've changed my mind... I'd... I'd like to come back inside... I don't want to stay out here any more... Funny things... I hear funny things out here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have you come across Fuchs?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fuchs...? No, it's not Fuchs... You must let me back in... I won't harm anyone... I promise...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'll see...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I promise! I'm much better now! I'll be good!! I'm all better!! Don't leave me here!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Norris continues his watch on the sedated trio. He anxiously tries to keep an eye on the various entrances behind and in front of him. He rubs his chest in pain.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER I'm getting worried about you. You ought to have a checkup.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's just not get worried about anything just now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER (yawning) After all this mess then.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nodding) After all this mess.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The winds are thick and vicious now. MacReady and Nauls pull themselves along the rope fighting their way up the slope. A violent gust sends MacReady's body horizontal, but still hanging onto the rope. The wind slaps him back down. His flare and torch tumble back toward Nauls. Nauls saves the torch from rolling down the hill. MacReady, lying vulnerable, watches Nauls pull his way toward him. He tenses. Nauls reaches him. A beat. He hands back his torch. Relieved, MacReady pulls himself upright.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: that line the wall. They have been torn apart. Childs and Palmer examine.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Auxiliary light cables...? Been cut.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cut, bullshit. Been pulled apart.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as they reach the top. The remaining flare their only light. Very dark. They stand on either side of the door. MacReady shoves it open. Pitch black inside. MacReady flips the light switch. Doesn't work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They enter. Hunched. Torches ready. The place is a mess. The winds as strong as on the outside. The single flare illuminating the ceiling. Almost all of the corrugated, steel roofing is gone. As if ripped off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady stares up incredulous, as they advance through the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nauls kicks over a chair. A naked, fleshy object bounds high into the air. Nauls thrusts out his torch, catching the breasts of the inflatable woman. She pops and is sucked out through the hole in the roof. Nauls tries to catch his breath.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (shouting to be heard) Where's the roof?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This storm do that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouting) Couldn't be possible. Must have weighted a ton and a half...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goddamn white women.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Underground, rickety corridor. Palmer stands by as Childs undoes the many locks to the room that houses his plants. One by one. Palmer twists his head in every which direction. Nervous. Childs pulls open the heavy door. A flush of snow and wind push them back. They wedge their bodies at the entrance to the lightless room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They enter. The light from the hall exposes the completely smashed-in window high above the plants. The plants look frozen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Saddened, angry, Childs goes to check the damage to his plants. Palmer, his face set in horror, yanks him back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Palmer readies his small torch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Palmer sprays them with flame. Childs pushes him to the ground, and tries to swat out the fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Palmer, his mouth agape with terror, screams and points to the closing door to their rear. Childs whirls.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: My babies.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Somebody broke in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now who'd go and do...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Childs!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let go of me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't get near 'em. The plants! They're alive. Those things can imitate anything...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's it going to do, being a plant?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We got to burn 'em.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now hold on, you dumb...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You stupid, sonofa...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: One arm outstretched, swings into view. An ax, embedded deep into his chest, pins his frozen body to the inside of the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norris startled by the scream, turns on the siren.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sanchez has joined Childs and Palmer. The body of Fuchs is still pinned to the door. Sanchez tries to wrench the ax loose. It is too deeply embedded and won't budge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sanchez observes Childs' hulking frame and adds pointedly:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Whoever put this through him...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...is one bad-ass and strong muther.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No one's that strong, boy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Tracking with the three men. Opening and closing doors, as they make their way back to the rec room. They keep their distance from each other, watching each other while they walk.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Why didn't it imitate Fuchs? Isn't that its number -- to get more recruits.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wasn't enough time. Generator was out, what...? Thirty minutes. Takes the bastards an hour, maybe two to absorb somebody.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why Fuchs?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He was working on a test. Fuchs must have been onto something. These bastards got scared and got rid of him. (suddenly realizing) ...Hey... Where's...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: shouting down a passageway.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: MacReady!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: bellowing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Nauls!! MacReady!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A strong driftwind streams snow across the ground obscuring everything but the very top of the buildings. The siren screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rigid, immobile faces. Listening to the storm overhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Silence, as the uneasy eyes measure one another.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How long they been out now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forty... Forty-five minutes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We better start closing off the outside hatchways.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: S OF THE COMPOUND Childs, Sanchez and Palmer -- closing off and bolting the entrances to the camp.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) All of you! Come here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Through the fogged-up windows, a figure can be seen approaching the main compound. It pulls and drags its way along the guide rope, fighting the gale force winds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: weapons in hand, huddle at the main doorway. They unbolt it. Sleet and hail send Nauls rolling in from the outside. The men force the door back and lock it. The weary Nauls kneels on the floor and gasps for air. The others surround him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nauls weighs each of them ominously, while digging down underneath his heavy jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pulls out a thick bundle of heavy clothing. It is mutilated and partially burned. He holds out the jacket to show the inside collar. Close on name tag -- it reads: R.J. MACREADY The men, as they examine in a hush.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men continue to examine in various states of disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs and Norris separate them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pounding at the door sends the men jerking backward. Nauls scampers to his feet. They tense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No answer as the men surround the door, their weapons ready. Fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men keep their voices low.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More pounding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The muffled breaking of a window down the hall. The men turn.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where's MacReady?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cut him loose of the line up by his shack.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cut him loose?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When we were up poking around his place... I found this...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...It was stashed in his old coal furnace... wind must have dislodged it... I don't think he saw me find it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Made sure I got ahead of him on the towline on the way back... cut him loose.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (incredulous) MacReady...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's one of them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (scared) When do you think it got to him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Could have been anytime. Anywhere.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Nauls, suspicious) If it did get to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, man...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When the lights went out...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would have been a perfect time...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right. Garry was missing... (pointedly) ...And Sanchez...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (goes for him) Fuck you, Palmer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is just what it wants... to pit us against each other.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Open up!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) ...Hey, somebody! Open up, it's me, MacReady... (still nothing) ...Come on, damn it... The towline snapped. Been crawling around like a seal out here...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (harsh whisper) Bullshit! He's got to know damn well I cut it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's open it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hell no.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shaking) You think he's changed into one of those Things?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He hasn't had enough time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Nothing human could have made it back here in this weather without a guideline...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) ...Where is everybody?! I'm half frostbit!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's open it. Now...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (edgy, hostile) Why you so damn anxious to let him in here...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (slightly trembling) He's so close. Maybe our best chance to blow him away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. Just let him freeze out there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (voice cracking) What if we're wrong about him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then we're wrong.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The supply window!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (terror) What we going to...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right... all right... we've got no choice now...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Pitch black. MacReady's voice is heard cursing as he appears to be stumbling around, looking for a light switch. He responds to the muffled voices at the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What's going on out there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Palmer stands by as Childs tries the knob. Locked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs rips a nearby fire ax off the wall and begins hacking away at the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Damn it, he's got the keys.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady begins to rummage through the supplies in the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs chops away. MacReady desperately continues rummaging through the supplies.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) You're a dead man, MacReady -- or a dead whatever the hell you are!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) We found your clothes -- the ones you tried to burn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What clothes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) You been made, MacReady.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Someone's trying to mark me, you bastard... trying to frame me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Childs cautions to Palmer as he prepares for one last blow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crunch. The door gives. The men move in. Their blow torches ready. They freeze. MacReady stands before them holding a lighted flare. His hair and clothing are covered with snow; his cheeks and nose blackened by frostbite. Tucked under his arm is an entire box of dynamite. He holds the flare dangerously close to the open box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He appears to mean it. They don't seem anxious to test him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They do. He follows them out into the hall.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Move in slow now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anyone messes with me -- the whole camp goes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Put those torches on the floor and back off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The men step backwards carefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They heed, retreating further down the hall. MacReady glances behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nauls and Norris, who have silently crept in through the supply window, come flying through the hacked-up door and barrel into MacReady. Both going straight for the flare. MacReady spins Nauls off and rips into Norris, sending him crashing violently into the wall. Nauls tackles MacReady's legs, pulling him to the floor. The others rush him. MacReady, still in control of the dynamite and flare, bellow:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They skid to a halt. Nauls crawls away, quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norris, lying on the floor, coughs as if gasping for breath. He quivers for a moment and then is still. Nauls crawls over to him and shakes him. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nauls listens to Norris' chest. MacReady stands.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...back way off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Where's the rest...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So help me I mean it!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's cool, man. We ain't near you, man... Stay cool...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, man, really. Just relax.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anybody touches me... we go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think he's breathing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go untie the Doc. Get him in here. Bring the others, too... (grins menacingly) From now on no one gets out of my sight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Norris' body is plopped on the examination table. Copper stumbles and is steadied by some of the men. MacReady continues to keep his distance. Copper places an oxygen mask over Norris' face. He then rips open his shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Copper begins swathing Norris' chest with a gelatin substance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sanchez pushes over the portable fibrillator. Copper climbs up on the table and straddles Norris' chest. Unnoticed, Clark paws the contents of the instrument tray behind his back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They do so. Copper holds electrical prongs over Norris' chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sanchez depresses the "on" button.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Copper presses the prongs onto Norris' chest and shoots a bolt of current. Norris' body heaves upward. A slight crackling sound and an odd chirp through the oxygen mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buzzz. Several more jolts from the prongs. Clark's hand has found a scalpel. He gently lifts it out, bringing it to his side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norris' body begins bounding up. More crackling and popping. His chest begins to break up and spread. The mask pops off -- a hideous mewing escaping from Norris' distorted mouth. The men jump back, incredulous. Dr. Copper scrambles off his chest and flops to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They watch on in stunned horror as The Thing that was Norris begins to change, to spread awkwardly on the slab. Its clothes tearing. A shoe splits in half and falls to the floor, exposing the beginnings of a talon. MacReady charges toward it, shooing the men off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He unloads with a stream of flame. The body writhes in pain, belching and hissing. The slab catches fire. It struggles, lunges for the floor, straightens up, and moves a few feet. A black and yellow substance rips through its trousers and squirts to the floor. Norris' body collapses on the fibrillating machine in flames. Extinguishers are ripped from the walls and put to work. MacReady watches the smoking particles of ooze in fascination, as they twitch and mew on the floor. Within seconds the fire is out. The men stand around in awe as they look upon The Thing that was once Norris. MacReady continues to observe the small particles. Their tiny squeals abating into silence.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So you sweethearts had yourselves a little trial. I just may have to kill you on general principle, Nauls.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Ever occur to the jury that anybody could have gotten to some of my clothes and stuck them up...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We ain't buying that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER Damn it, quit the bickering and give me a hand. Wheel that fibrillator over here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER Palmer, turn on that oxygen and hold the mask over his face... Childs, grab his shoulders.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to MacReady, threatening) You're going to have to sleep sometime.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER Quiet down... (to Sanchez) ...turn that thing on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER Now hold him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm a real light sleeper, Childs...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER Enough, MacReady!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER Again... More current this time, Sanchez...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And if anyone tries to wake me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER Damn you, MacReady!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: God... what...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get out of the way!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: MacReady, still carrying the industrial torch, has maneuvered all the men into the room. He holds Garry's .44. He has untaped the explosives from his chest and laid them on the nearby table next to two more boxes of dynamite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tosses a ream of steel cable and some rope to Palmer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady points the .44 at Childs' head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady cocks his gun. Childs holds his ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beat. Clark springs for MacReady. Scalpel raised. MacReady spins and fires three shots, point-blank, the forces of the charges sending Clark flying backwards. The others, themselves about to pounce, stop -- as MacReady whirls the torch and gun back toward them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What you got in mind, MacReady?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A little test.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What kind of test?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sure a lot of you already know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Palmer, you and Copper tie everyone down. Real tight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For your health.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to others) Let's rush him. He's not going to blow us all up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Damn if I won't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a beat) You ain't tying me up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then I'll have to kill you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then kill me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I mean it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I guess you do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: being tied securely to couches and chairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady turns on a Bunsen burner while he cuts the rubber covering off an electrical cord, exposing the copper wire. All the while, he keeps his eye on the men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Copper starts to tie Palmer to the small couch next to Childs and Garry.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Tie up Clark, too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (bemused) He's dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Norris looked pretty dead, himself. Bullets don't kill these Things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (muttering) We should have jumped his ass.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now Copper, you tie Palmer up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're going to draw a little bit of everybody's blood.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you going to do? Drink it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Watching Norris in there... gave me the idea that maybe every part of you bastards is a whole. Every piece of you is self-sufficient, an animal unto itself. When a man bleeds it's just tissue. But blood from one of you Things won't obey. It's a newly formed individual with a built-in desire to protect its own life. When attacked, your blood will try and survive -- and crawl away from a hot needle say.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: grimacing as Dr. Copper pinches a scalpel to his thumb and collects a small portion of his blood in a dish. All the men have been tied up. Palmer, Childs and Garry on the small couch. The others, including the lifeless corpse of Clark, in chairs. Copper returns the plate to the table and sets it down in line with the other plates of blood that he has collected. The names of each man have been scribbled onto the plates. MacReady slides the Doctor a fresh plate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Copper cuts his thumb, his blood dribbles onto the plate. He stands nervously for a beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Copper pushes it toward MacReady.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Copper steps backward, moisture beginning to collect on his brow. MacReady begins to heat the copper wire over the Bunsen burner. The men watch intently. The wire begins to glow. MacReady points the torch directly at the Doctor. Both of them perspiring. MacReady lifts the glowing wire from the flame. The Doctor is dead still. MacReady slowly touches the wire to the Doctor's plate. A soft hiss. MacReady heats it again and tries once more. The same soft hiss. MacReady and the Doctor both let out a sigh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hands Copper the torch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He cuts himself with the scalpel and begins collecting his own blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He heats the wire and puts it to his plate. The same harmless hissing. All eyes continue to watch as he tries again. The same result. Childs mumbles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He heats the wire and lays it in Clark's dish. The hissing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady glances over the group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sets Palmer's plate in front of him and heats the wire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Screech!!! The blood howls, trying to crawl off the plate. Palmer bolts forward with incredible force, racing for MacReady; his face splitting; his mouth roaring -- dragging the couch, Childs and Garry with him. He smashes into MacReady knocking him over the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all happened too fast. Copper tries to get off a burst of flame. The ever-changing Palmer breaks his bonds and leaps on the Doctor. The others sit helpless, struggling at their bindings. MacReady dives on Palmer's back and the three go rolling to the floor. Screeching. Crackling. MacReady pounds viciously at Palmer's head. A powerful, shirt-splitting arm sends him skidding across the floor. Copper momentarily has control of the torch. Just as he positions it, Palmer's mouth splits from his chin to his forehead and engulfs the entirety of the Doctor's head. The big torch slaps against the wall. Palmer bounds to his feet, wrapping his arms around the dangling, struggling body of Dr. Copper. The men are screaming hysterically. MacReady tries to fire up the bruised torch. Busted. Won't work. Frustrated, he charges up behind Palmer and begins hammering the thick steel instrument over his head. The shirt of Palmer's back erupts in MacReady's face. Splitting and ripping wildly, exposing the beginnings of yet another orifice. A blackened, iron-strong tongue lunges outward. Stunned, MacReady manages to elude it, diving for the top of the table by the boxes of dynamite. MacReady lights the fuse of a thick roll and bounds from the table. Palmer awkwardly spins in circles, swinging the Doctor's body like a propeller blade, struggling to keep on balance, as he advances on MacReady. The second orifice, spitting and snarling as it continues to take form. MacReady waits until Palmer's back spins around, facing him. Only two yards away, MacReady flings his lit roll into the ever-evolving second mouth and leaps onto the couch covering Childs and Garry with his body. A muffled boom, as the swallowed explosive ignites from deep within Palmer and sends his flesh splattering all over the room. MacReady rolls away from Childs and Garry as fast as he can.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Now you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Slide it back here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now step way back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I guess you're okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . COPPER (shaken, facetious) Thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't think you'd use that fibrillator on Norris if you were one of them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Watch them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now I'll show you what I already know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Load of bullshit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'll see. Let's try Clark.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So Clark was human, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So that make you a murderer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Palmer now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pure nonsense. This won't prove a damn thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thought you'd feel that way, Garry. You were the only one who could have gotten to that blood plasma... (placing the wire in Palmer's dish) ...we'll do you last...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Copper!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: perspiring profusely, his hand trembling slightly, prepares to continue the test. He heats the wire. The men are pouring sweat, white-knuckled. One of the smaller torches is pointed at Nauls. He closes his eyes. MacReady places the heated wire into his plate. Hiss. MacReady exhales. Nauls opens his eyes. MacReady unties Nauls with one hand, while the torch stays glued to the others. MacReady heats the wire once again. Both he and Nauls have torches aimed at Sanchez. Sanchez is near tears. The wire is dipped into the plate... Hisssss. Sanchez breaks down and sobs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits stoicly, while he watches the preparations for his turn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nauls and Sanchez take aim five yards away. Fierce, determined. The wire comes off the flame into the plate... the harmless hissing. The muscles in Childs' face melt into a sigh.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Let's do it, Bwana.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Muthafu...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: snap towards station manager Garry. Childs, suddenly realizing who he is sitting next to, squirms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nauls rips away his bindings. The other two stand guard. Childs scrambles off the couch and onto the floor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Get me... get me the hell away from... cut me loose, damn it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: stares grimly ahead. Childs soaks his clothing with a can of gasoline. He is then surrounded. The room tenses, adrenalin pumps, breathing halts. The burner. The torches. The wire. The plate. Garry's face. Hisssss. MacReady tries again. Hiss. The men breathe. Their torches are lowered. Nauls throws his on the floor. Sanchez and Childs flop down in chairs. MacReady wipes his face. A long silence. Sanchez weeps quietly with relief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beat. Childs starts to giggle. The strain on MacReady's jaw begins to lessen. Garry sits catatonic. Nauls scowls at Childs' uncontrollable laughter. The infectious rasping causes MacReady a slight smile as he looks up, taking comfort in the sound of the raging Antarctic wind vibrating the roof. Nauls, untying Garry, grumbles, at Childs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs wipes his eyes and grins over toward MacReady. His smile fades, MacReady is now stone-faced. Childs' grin goes stale, in sudden realization.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I know you gentlemen have been through a lot. But when you find the time... I'd rather not spend the rest of the winter tied to this couch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut the damn hell up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (almost a whisper) Blair...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The wind rumbles. The storm is at its peak. MacReady, Childs and Nauls, guided by their flares, pull themselves along the steadying rope, headed, for Blair's shack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door is wide open. They pause by the entrance, trying to balance against the wind. They enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Empty. A few of the floorboards are loosened. They pull them up. They stare down into a large hole beneath the planking. Something is down there. They pull up more boards. The hole is some fifteen feet deep. Its dimensions are the same as the shack. Its space is almost completely taken up by some strange metallic object. Crudely fashioned, a patchwork job, but streamlined. Sheets of corrugated steel are visible; but cut apart and welded into the desired shapes. The object appears to be unfinished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady pulls out a dozen tightly wrapped sticks of dynamite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Far off, amidst the howling gale -- the screeching. The men jump. MacReady lights the fuse, as they make it to the exit. He tosses it in.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Everything that's been missing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Spaceship of some kind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Smart S.O.B. He put it together piece by piece.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where was he trying to go?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anyplace but here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But he ain't going to make it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The explosion echoes behind them. The men pull along. Their heads jerk in circles, searching into the blackness. Some twenty yards to their rear something swooshes down, severing the line. The wind sends the men tumbling along the ice. Childs loosens the line and is blown away, rolling out of sight. MacReady and Nauls have lost their torches. They pull feverishly along the ground trying to make it to the compound. The screeching closes in behind them. MacReady loses his grip on the rope and is blown toward the main building. He crawls along looking for an opening. Nauls slides near the outside entrance to the dog kennel. He climbs down through the open stairwell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady has found the broken window. He rolls through it, landing on the frozen plants below. Something smashes at the glass above his head, trying to get in. He sprints for the door. Fuchs' frozen body is still pinned to it with the ax. MacReady grapples with the stiff torso which blocks the knob. He finally gets it open and lets himself out, slamming and locking the door from the hall. Fuchs' body swings eerily, back and forth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady charges up the stairs from the plant room. He zooms down the twisting corridors, opening and closing doors. He rounds a bend and crashes into Nauls coming the other way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pouring gasoline into empty bottles, preparing Molotov cocktails. Garry is connecting an electrical device: wires attached to two portable generators. MacReady appears to be injecting something into empty contact capsules. The men work feverishly. Nauls rushes in with another box of dynamite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nauls begins cutting the wicks off the dynamite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wind belts into the roofing overhead. Garry sets the wiring to the main doorway. MacReady begins blocking off one of the other entrances with a large computer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They block off a door with two heavy electrical games.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nauls starts lacing his skates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady further barricades the door with small couch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sanchez and Nauls start to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He dispenses the capsules.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A grim silence.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What about Childs?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forget about Childs. He's over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Make 'em short. They'll go off quicker if we need to use them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What if it doesn't come?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It'll come. It needs us. We're the only thing left to imitate... (to Sanchez) Give me a hand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Sanchez) You and Nauls got to block off the west side bunks, the mess hall and the kitchen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (protest) You crazy? He might be inside already?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Chance we got to take. We got to force him to come down the east side to the door we got rigged.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He might just wait us out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going to blow the generator when you get back. He'll have to come for us -- or freeze.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've got portable heaters -- we'll last longer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Hold it.
dialogue.name: dialogue
