dialogue.raw_text: Sodium cyanide. We place them between our cheeks and gums... This Thing can't imitate anything that's dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If it gets a hold of you -- bite down... They're supposed to be fast and painless... Now move.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sanchez and Nauls inch their way through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady rips linen, soaks the strips in gas, and stuffs them in the Molotov bottles. Garry tests the current on the door. Popping, sparks, smoke.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Looks good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One thousand volts. Should be enough.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Nauls pushes a stove, reinforcing a locked door. Five yards away, Sanchez maneuvers the refrigerator in front of another outlet. Sanchez hears a quiet purring, bubbling sound. He turns to Nauls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A blaring. They whip their attention to stereo speakers on either side of the kitchen. Rock music screams out. Top volume.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You hear that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hear what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The same loud music. MacReady and Garry look to the three speakers attached to the walls. MacReady yells his incomprehension to Garry. Garry tries to respond. Their voices drowned out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Empty. Another of the stereo speakers that line the walls, thunders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nauls, in sudden realization, screams over the din and points back in the direction they came.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's got into the pub! It's turned on the stereo!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's in between us and them!! How we going to get back?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't hear you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: MacReady, cursing, rips the speakers off the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The music is now subdued within the room, but continues booming throughout the camp. Nauls' scream can be barely heard.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What are they doing out there?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's he saying?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: at the top of his lungs...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A sharp, red, talon-like fingernail, pierces the top of the door above Nauls' head. It saws downward, quickly. Black goo drips through the slit. The sawing obscured by the music. Sanchez, eyes bulging, points. Nauls turns. A claw rips through the wood. Nauls dives to the floor. In the opposite direction, behind Sanchez, another arm splits through the door and the refrigerator, extends itself five feet and yanks Sanchez back as if he were a puppet. Sanchez struggles, looking imploringly at Nauls. He bites down on his capsule. Nauls takes off like a speed skater.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: MacReady! We been cut off!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The sound of the screeching over the music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He opens the door. Looks down the hall. No one. The speakers -- blaring music.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Got to get to the generator.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: full speed down the maze. Left. Right. Totally reckless. He hits a straightaway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: from out of nowhere, blasts through the hallway wall, directly in Nauls' path. A thick arm pins the body to the other side. Unable to stop, Nauls skids out of control, banging into the sides of the wall, his cyanide capsule flying out of his mouth. Whatever the rest of it is, it starts to crumble through the wall. Nauls dives over the arm, somersaults to his feet and takes off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady, running, spots Nauls careening out of a turn, heading toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nauls blazes by him. MacReady hears the snarls and screeches heading his way. He streaks after Nauls.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Get back!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The generator!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Screw the generator!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They make it in. Lock the door... MacReady tries to catch his breath. Nauls shakes, pants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Garry fiddles with the two generators.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The loud music in the compound is turned off. MacReady shuts off the lights. The men spread out. Silence.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Got Sanchez... World War Three wouldn't mess with this fucker... Can go through walls... And it's like all over the place...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Calm down and get in your position.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Position, my ass...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going to bump this up, much as I can.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Boulder Dam might do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The men watch all the doors. Dead silence. Dark. Whispers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sound of a door opening and closing. Far off. Another creaking door is opened. A rustling. Still far off. MacReady and Nauls spread further apart. The soft bubbling, cooling sound. A slight scratch at the door. Garry's hand tightens around the generator switches. The scratching gets more pronounced. MacReady cautions Garry with a whisper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door begins to pound from the outside. Nauls and MacReady light two cocktails each. The door booms. The room's foundations shake. The ceiling quivers. The gas bombs are cocked. From the roof The Thing roars down into their midst. Stunned, the men stumble back. MacReady throws his gas bomb. Nauls the same. For a moment it stands silhouetted in flame. Enormous. Grotesque. Garry bolts for the main door. The Thing's tongue spirals from his mouth and spears him. The good two-thirds of its body follows its tongue and engulfs Garry by the door. Another leg slaps Nauls to the ground. MacReady dodges still another appendage, dives on the generators and throws the switch. The current rips through the door. Garry dies instantly. One of The Thing's talons, still caught in the door, sends it writhing in pain. It literally rips the door from its latchings and pounds it to the ground, trying to shake it loose. Nauls, hobbles, scrambles, out of the opening. MacReady dives through the window and out into the storm.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How long's it been?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Little over two hours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe it ain't coming.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then we go after him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bet the last place you ever go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The distant sound of a motor. Nauls, battered and bloodied, his leg apparently broken, crawls along the ground. Another sound, a bubbling and gurgling is heard well to his rear. But closing. The terror forces him to drag faster, oblivious to the pain. He reaches the bathroom stall. Crawls in. Locks it. The gurgling nears. Leaning on the toilet seat, he looks about himself, frantically. The Presence pauses at the door. A scratching. Nauls paws, rips at a cracked and weathered slab of wood, cutting his fingers as he tries to break it off the siding. A strong blow begins to breach the stall door. Nauls finally unhinges the piece of wood, brings the jagged end to one side of his throat and rips...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The motorized rumbling nears. The wall seems to explode. The tractor barrels into the lab. Its enormous shovel scooper tearing half the room to shreds. MacReady drives. His eyes glint like a wild man's; he looks stark raving mad. His frostbite, now in an advanced stage, resembles black war paint. He clenches a stick of dynamite between his teeth, like a buccaneer's cutlass. Two large, compressed air tanks have been tied together at the top and are draped around his neck. They are marked -- HYDROGEN. They are used for the weather balloons. He pulls the tractor to a stop, yanks the stick from his mouth, grins and bellows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady guns it through the next wall and into the infirmary. Medical equipment goes flying. The machine is powerful; the prefabricated walls buckling under its force.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, creep! Just you and me now! Be on your toes! We're going to do a little remodeling!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A trail of viscous yellow ooze leads around a bend. Boom. MacReady rams into the mess hall, sweeping away tables, chairs. He sings out loud the lyrics of some Mexican song. All the while he keeps his eyes on everything. Through the kitchen. The foundation is crumbling. He sings on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gurgling and hissing. A taloned arm slinks around a corner in retreat.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Chime in if you know that words, old boy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: plows through several more rooms before ending up in the pub area. He backs it up and retrieves a bottle of liquor from the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes a drink and rams through another wall.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You like whiskey? Come on, join me for a drink. Be good for you. Grow fangs on your chest.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The tractor blazes into the rec room. MacReady parks it directly in front of the hole in the roof, created by The Thing when it surprised them earlier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pulls off the heavy hydrogen tanks and drapes them over the tractor. As he talks his eyes move like a hawk passing from roof, to doorways, to rubble. Wind and ice bristle through the gaping holes, stinging MacReady with the cold. He winces at his mittenless, blackened fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes a swig from his bottle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A slight tremor perks his eyes and ears. He looks up through the hole, then around. He lights a lighter and cups it in his hand near the stick of dynamite in his lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A stronger tremor. The adrenalin pumps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The floor shakes. MacReady stands, his head whirling around the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The tractor inches up off the ground. MacReady falls forward and looks straight down through the chassis and into the vile and grinning face below. A claw flashes up, splitting the steering wheel but missing his face. He depresses the ignition, bolting the tractor ten feet. He jumps, hanging onto the edge of the hole in the ceiling. The Thing's face and arms burst through the metal plating of the tractor. The reaching claws just miss him as he pulls himself through.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Damn it, ran out of gas.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sweetheart, it's going to get mighty cold in here soon... You better make your move... I mean, hell, I'm only one person...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know you're bugged because we ruined your trip, right? Spiffy little toy you had there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But your real hang up is your looks...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (wants him bad) Atta boy. I know you're around.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, sucker.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He lights his fuse, drops in the stick, turns and runs. Half of The Thing's grotesque and angular torso bolts up through the hole, howling in fury. An appendage springs outward and winds around MacReady's jacket, hissing like acid into the fabric. An immense explosion. The hydrogen tanks send a white fireball fifty feet into the sky. The Thing's body disintegrating almost immediately. The force of the blast sweeps MacReady off the roof. He and the severed appendage crash to the hard ice in flames. He rolls over and over trying to smother the fire and tear off the insidious limb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A ruin. One half of it burnt almost to the ground. MacReady wears a thick blanket which covers him like a shroud, from his shoulders to the floor. He walks bent over and in much pain, trying to blunt patches of fire with an extinguisher. It is futile. He gives up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mostly untouched by the fire, but like most of the rest of the camp, exposed to the outside. The storm has settled considerably.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lighting a cigar. His hands are heavily wrapped. He pours himself a drink. A puffy white hand, missing two fingers, enters the frame and whirls a startled MacReady around. It is Childs. White and black blotches cover his frostbitten face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks as weak as MacReady. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Both men speak guardedly and stare at each other suspiciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Childs steps back, keeping his distance. He indicates his puffy white hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady, carrying the bottle and glass, limps over and sits down behind a gaming table. There is a chess set and several decks of cards. The two men continue to eye each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady begins setting up a non-electronic chessboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady puffs on his cigar. He reveals a small blowtorch from under the table and places it beside him on top.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They regard each other for a moment. Childs painfully sits down across from MacReady.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MacReady grins and hands the bottle to Childs. Childs smiles back and takes a healthy swig.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Did you kill it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean "you think so?"
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. I got it. (refers to Childs' condition) Pretty mean frostbite.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It'll turn black again soon enough. Then I guess I'll be losing the whole thing... (refers to feet) ...Think my toes are already gone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So you're the only one who made it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not the only one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The fire's got the temperature way up all over camp... won't last long though.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Neither will we.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe we should try and fix the radio... try and get some help.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe we shouldn't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then we'll never make it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe we shouldn't make it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (beat) If you're worried about anything, let's take that blood test of yours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If we've got any surprises for each other -- we shouldn't be in any condition to do anything about it. (beat) You play chess?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I guess I'll be learning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The fires smolder on. Bright embers dance in the blackness -- pushed by the soughing wind.
direction.name: direction
